item.title: The Future of Science, Marko On Markets, Cumulative Knowledge, The Story That Changes The World, Autonomous AI, The One Thing Bigger Than AI and Curious Minds Events
item.description:
The Curious Mind Podcast - September 11th, 2024

In this week's episode: a discussion of whether science is making any progress; how trade wars don't work in a multipolar world; Tom Morgan's exploration of how the Hero's Journey is a map for life; insights into AI's future from Andrej Karpathy; and why GLP-1 drugs might be an even bigger theme than AI. We also touch on the distinction between cumulative and cyclical knowledge, the dawn of AI agents, and how AI is transforming business models and human productivity.

Main topics discussed:

  • Challenges in modern scientific progress
  • The evolving interplay of science, religion, and culture
  • Marko Papic's insights on global economic transition
  • Cumulative vs. Cyclical Knowledge
  • Tom Morgan's "The Story That Changes The World"
  • Andrej Karpathy's vision for AI's future
  • The dawn of the AI agent era
  • GLP-1 drugs and their potential impact

Resources mentioned:

  • Philip Ball's interview with the Mercatus Center
  • Morgan Housel's article on cumulative vs cyclical knowledge
  • Tom Morgan's original article on "The Story That Changes The World"
  • Tom Morgan's talk at the Sohn Conference
  • Azeem Azhar's post on GLP-1 agonists
  • Stephen Clapham's podcast and newsletter
